comments.body: When no hosts are found with SSH, this test will silently not do anything. Would it be better to test for this scenario and then skip the test?
it used to skip the test if there are no ready ssh-able nodes, with this change it will fail. Is it intentional? (PR introduced test skipping: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/101866)

This new combination of `GetBoundedReadySchedulableNodes()` and `hostExec.Execute()` creates a pod on the specific node and run the specified command in the pod without using ssh.
This pr requires just schedulable nodes, and I think it is good that the test fails if there is not such nodes on the environment.

Is there a relation of `gce,gke`and `crictl` or just the CI combination?
I think that this will run now everywhere where the binary is available, i.e., it will run on kind jobs too,
